Karlach_PostEA.synopsis: First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell.The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.

PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate.synopsis: A character reacts when sitting on one of the stone chairs in the tollhouse basement and activating the pressure plate hidden there. There is an audible click, but a second character needs to be in the other chair to open the secret chamber. The line needs to hint that there is a second part to solving the puzzle.

Karlach.synopsis: First meeting with Karlach, future Origin/Companion. She's a fugitive, wounded and hiding from cultists who are hunting for her to drag her back to hell.The dialogue begins with a stream separating the player and Karlach, as she points a crossbow at them when they approach, holding them at bay. She's fierce, defiant, and intense. But friendly and grateful if the player helps. Shouldn't be too angry - she's in a bad situation and doesn't know who to trust, but she's also been in far worse situations. She has a sense of humour about her predicatment, no matter how bad it gets.

AD_KarlachWounded.synopsis: Karlach's ADs as she tends to a wound inflicted by the false paladins.

Dead_Karlach.synopsis: Dialog with Karlach if she dies before being recruited into the party.

PAD_Karlach.synopsis: Karlach is at her default recruitment state.
PAD_Karlach.how_to_trigger: Go to Karlach's recruitment and stand near her.

AD_KarlachHealed.synopsis: A wounded Karlach responds when players heal her out of dialog. She's extremely grateful.

HeadLoot.synopsis: After killing Karlach, players have the option to study her corpse and cut off her head if they have the mission to kill her and retrieve the head.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: The dialogue sessions for Karlach appear to have branching pathways. In one branch, the player meets and then potentially heals/recruits Karlach. In the other branch, the player kills her, which then leads to dialogs such as Dead_Karlach and the option HeadLoot. In addition, there is an initial meeting session (Karlach) that logically should happen before a later version (Karlach_PostEA), implying an ordering if both appear. Also when Karlach is wounded by false paladins, the wounded dialog (AD_KarlachWounded) should come before the healed dialog (AD_KarlachHealed), and then after healing, her recruitment dialog (PAD_Karlach) may occur. On the other hand, if the player kills her instead of recruiting her, then the death branch is triggered. In that death branch the dialog Dead_Karlach is encountered, and subsequently the HeadLoot option becomes available. In summary, the “living” path events and the “death” branch events are mutually exclusive. The session PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate, however, seems unrelated to Karlach’s storyline and does not have ordering or exclusiveness constraints in this context.

Karlach_PostEA_13.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_13.text: Please tell me you come in peace. Last fucker who came through here properly blew out my candles.
Karlach_PostEA_13.context: NodeContext: Euphemism for the player who was here earlier having killed her.

Karlach_PostEA_34.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_34.context: InternalNodeContext: In this iteration, the player has killed all the tieflings in the grove before meeting Karlach. She will not join the player but she may be convinced not to attack them.NodeContext: Cold rage.

Karlach_PostEA_162.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_162.text: I know what you did. All those people in the druid's grove - you slaughtered them to a man.

Karlach_PostEA_295.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_295.text: Did it make you feel important, huh? Did it make you feel big?

Karlach_PostEA_17.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_17.text: The last person you're ever going to meet. Karlach's my name. I've got a knack for killing demons and devils, and I think I found my next target.

Karlach_PostEA_207.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_207.text: You've got it all wrong. I've got a contract for your head, and I'm going to take it.

Karlach_PostEA_152.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_152.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

Karlach_PostEA_58.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_58.text: Listen, you've got the wrong idea about me. I didn't have anything to do with what happened to those people.

Karlach_PostEA_346.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_346.text: That's a load of shit. But you know what? Today, I have other priorities.

Karlach_PostEA_208.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_208.text: Hahaha! Gods, you're pathetic when you lie. Come on - time to pay for you did. I hope it was worth it.

Karlach_PostEA_191.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_191.text: Please - more violence won't change the past. Leave me be, and I'll leave you too.

Karlach_PostEA_296.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_296.text: You're right. Violence won't change the past. But the right kind of violence can protect the future. You're dangerous. I can't let you leave.

Karlach_PostEA_5.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_5.text: If you value your life, you'll stand down.

Karlach_PostEA_91.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_91.text: Argh! I've got enough to worry about without your screams giving my position away.

Karlach_PostEA_133.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_133.text: Get the fuck out of here. Now. Before I change my mind.

Karlach_PostEA_157.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_157.text: Oh, I want to live. Just not in a world with you in it.
Karlach_PostEA_157.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

Karlach_PostEA_353.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_353.text: Listen, it was all a misunderstanding. I didn't mean for them to die.

Karlach_PostEA_303.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_303.text: You're not the worst liar I've ever met. But you're daft as a brick if you think I'm going to believe that.

Karlach_PostEA_337.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_337.text: I don't have to explain myself to you.

Karlach_PostEA_323.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_323.text: True. I don't need you to speak. There's nothing you can say for yourself, anyway.

Karlach_PostEA_310.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_310.text: It did, actually. I am very powerful and strong!

Karlach_PostEA_236.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_236.text: That might be true. And all your power and strength is going to lead you right where you belong. The Hells.
Karlach_PostEA_236.context: NodeContext: About to fight the player/ max burning on 'the hells'. Max anger.

Karlach_PostEA_74.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_74.text: The memory of their curdling cries has been a balm to my blistered mind.

Karlach_PostEA_52.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_52.text: It almost isn't fair, striking down a lunatic. But for someone as dangerous as you, I'll make an exception.

Karlach_PostEA_317.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_317.text: I - I - I... please, there's something inside me I can't control.

Karlach_PostEA_299.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_299.text: I know the feeling. So come on - let's see whose is worse.

Karlach_PostEA_40.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_40.text: Thank the gods for you. I thought I was done there. You did me a big favour. I won't forget it.

Karlach_PostEA_50.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_50.text: Please tell me you come in peace.
Karlach_PostEA_50.context: NodeContext: A different player attacked Karlach before player came along.

Karlach_PostEA_43.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_43.text: Changed your mind about teaming up?

Karlach_PostEA_120.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_120.text: Pretty sure I told you to fuck off, mate.

Karlach_PostEA_129.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_129.text: You kill me, you bring me back. I'd be furious if I didn't want the fucker strong enough to kill me on my side.

Karlach_PostEA_182.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_182.text: You did me in, then brought me back. I'd be impressed if I weren't so pissed off.

Karlach_PostEA_212.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_212.text: Changed your mind about teaming up?

Karlach_PostEA_287.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_287.text: Got it in one. Let's go after whoever's hunting you.

Karlach_PostEA_172.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_172.text: No, but I'm taking your head.

Karlach_PostEA_145.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_145.text: I met the people looking for you - and killed them.

Karlach_PostEA_70.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_70.text: I met the people looking for you - and took care of them.

Karlach_PostEA_6.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_6.text: You - did? That's amazing. Join up with me; let me do you a favour in return.

Karlach_PostEA_205.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_205.text: I met the people looking for you. They say you're a killer - a fiend.

Karlach_PostEA_364.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_364.text: I never killed anyone that didn't deserve it. Devils, demons, and the fiends that serve 'em - no mercy.

Karlach_PostEA_314.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_314.text: But if they've fed you some lies about me going after innocents, that's a crock of shit.

Karlach_PostEA_232.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_232.text: Join my team, then. I could use someone with your talents.

Karlach_PostEA_329.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_329.text: You better not be lying. If I leave you be, it'll be a leap of faith.

Karlach_PostEA_343.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_343.text: Got no use for lies. Life's interesting enough on its own.

Karlach_PostEA_215.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_215.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Karlach is crouched, head in hands, breathing heavily, surrounded by flames, burning. Karlach start straight from crouched pose [Choices]
NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within

Karlach_PostEA_90.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_PostEA_90.text: *One horn. This is the devil Wyll and the paladins of Tyr want dead.*

Karlach_PostEA_272.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_272.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Never been better." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_49.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_49.text: Well fuck me. It's you. From the nautiloid. Please tell me I found you before those so-called paladins of Tyr did.

Karlach_PostEA_92.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_92.text: First, I'd like to know how you controlled those flames.

Karlach_PostEA_116.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_116.text: Nice of you to ask. Lately I've gotten used to being called 'devil'. No follow-up questions.

Karlach_PostEA_101.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_101.text: The truth is... well, it's a long story. And I'll tell it, but -

Karlach_PostEA_292.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_292.text: I don't remember you from the ship. Where were you?

Karlach_PostEA_241.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_241.text: Now that's a story. And I'll tell it to you, too, but truth be told, we shouldn't stay here too long. See, these 'paladins' have -

Karlach_PostEA_121.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_121.text: I met a group of your victims, if that's what you mean. They told me what you are.

Karlach_PostEA_105.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_105.text: Believe me, I never killed anyone who didn't -

Karlach_PostEA_271.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_271.text: Haven't met any Tyrrans lately, no.

Karlach_PostEA_219.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_219.text: Good. Great. Glad I don't have to kill you.

Karlach_PostEA_119.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_119.text: What quarrel do you have with these Tyrrans?

Karlach_PostEA_240.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_240.text: Me? None. They're the ones chasing me down. But believe me, these so-called paladins are anything but. They -

Karlach_PostEA_233.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_233.text: I serve the Just God. What quarrel have you with his faithful?

Karlach_PostEA_311.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_311.text: Me and justice are good mates, believe me. The goons chasing me are anything but -

Karlach_PostEA_334.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_334.text: Try again. And pick your next words carefully.
Karlach_PostEA_334.context:
CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Try again." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_375.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_375.text: Well fuck me. It's you. From the mind flayers' ship. Let me guess: you met a group of burnt Tyrran paladins on your way over.

Karlach_PostEA_228.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_228.text: Steady on, soldier. Ahh. That's the stuff.
Karlach_PostEA_228.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Steady on, soldier."
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"Ahh. That's the stuff." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_227.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_227.text: She looks dangerous - watch her carefully.

Karlach_PostEA_304.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_304.text: Well fuck me. It's you. From the ship. Haven't taken any bounties from a burnt Tyr dink, have you?
Karlach_PostEA_304.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. She spot sthe player and locks eyes. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_57.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_57.text: These are no natural flames - prepare to fight.

Karlach_PostEA_340.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_340.text: Stand back, or I'll melt your eyes out of your skull.
Karlach_PostEA_340.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player steps forward and Karlach rises to her full height, flames raging hotter than ever. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_46.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_46.text: I'd know that stink anywhere. You've come from the Hells.

Karlach_PostEA_322.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_322.text: So I have. And it looks like a bit of the Hells have come with me.
Karlach_PostEA_322.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_270.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_270.text: You there - are you from Elturel?

Karlach_PostEA_94.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_94.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Me?"
She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down.
"I wish." From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_327.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_327.text: Met some of the Elturians who got trapped in the Hells, though. They did less time than me, but no easier.

Karlach_PostEA_286.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_286.text: I know you - you're the monster the Blade of Frontiers is hunting.

Karlach_PostEA_35.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_35.text: Gods, is he still on my tail? I'm embarrassed for him.
Karlach_PostEA_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: She breathes heavily a little more, then slowly stands, smiles, laughs, and breathes easily, feeling her power, super-saiyan style. After a little while, the flames die down. From crouch state to stand state [Choices]

Karlach_PostEA_290.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_290.text: You with the so-called 'paladins of Tyr'? Or straight from the grand high devil herself?

Karlach_PostEA_386.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_386.text: Neither. I just know what to do when I see a devil: kill it.

Karlach_PostEA_110.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_110.text: I'm no devil. And you're no bounty hunter. I saw you before. On the mind flayers' ship.
Karlach_PostEA_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire dies down. Calms to default state.

Karlach_PostEA_26.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_PostEA_26.text: *A great heat roars through you; her heat, fiery as the Hells.*
Karlach_PostEA_26.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

Karlach_PostEA_149.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_PostEA_149.text: *Then you're lost in visions of demonic armies as you tear through a landscape of fire and blood.*

Karlach_PostEA_142.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_PostEA_142.text: *The Blood War. You saw it from above as the nautiloid passed through Avernus - this woman was on the front line.*

Karlach_PostEA_247.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_247.text: It's the tadpole in our heads. It connects us.

Karlach_PostEA_86.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_86.text: Fuck's sake. Mountains as far as the eye can see.
Karlach_PostEA_86.context: NodeContext: A bit of humor, a bit of resignation. One obstacle after another.

Karlach_PostEA_127.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_127.text: Guess that explains the voices. From that peek I got into your head, you've made some inroads trying to get the thing sorted. But alas, no joy.

Karlach_PostEA_198.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_198.text: Maybe you ought to shed some light on what I just saw.

Karlach_PostEA_82.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_82.text: The Blood War. But believe me, my friend, the fighting wasn't even the worst part.

Karlach_PostEA_85.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_85.text: From that peek I got into your head, I'm not the only one with problems on top of problems. A mind flayer tadpole, huh? And no joy getting it sorted as of yet, I see.

Karlach_PostEA_22.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_22.text: Well met, soldier. Now that we're old pals, how would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?

Karlach_PostEA_150.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_150.text: A little background, if your moral compass needs something to point at...
Karlach_PostEA_150.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

Karlach_PostEA_122.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_122.text: You already know I fought in the Blood War. I was good at killing demons. Really good.

Karlach_PostEA_179.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_179.text: So good Zariel, the archdevil herself, made me her personal attack dog.

Karlach_PostEA_347.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_347.text: I played along until I could get the fuck out of there. Took me ten years to properly escape, but now I'm free.

Karlach_PostEA_2.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_2.text: Zariel's sent goon after goon to hunt me down, but believe me when I tell you I'm not going.

Karlach_PostEA_336.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_336.text: The latest yappy little dogs she's sicced on me are nearby. A group of dopes posing as Paladins of Tyr. Want to help me take 'em down?

Karlach_PostEA_193.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_193.text: Let's send them back where they came from.

Karlach_PostEA_319.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_319.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.

Karlach_PostEA_280.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_280.text: After we've mopped them up, we can work on evicting this parasite and take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

Karlach_PostEA_87.speaker: Lae'zel
Karlach_PostEA_87.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

Karlach_PostEA_242.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_242.text: I'd hug you if it wouldn't scorch your skin off.

Karlach_PostEA_1.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_1.text: Hang on - I said I'd help you, not team up with you long-term.

Karlach_PostEA_267.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_267.text: Trust me - when you see what I'm capable of, you won't regret it.

Karlach_PostEA_285.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_PostEA_285.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

Karlach_PostEA_357.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_PostEA_357.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
Karlach_PostEA_357.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

Karlach_PostEA_335.speaker: Gale
Karlach_PostEA_335.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
Karlach_PostEA_335.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

Karlach_PostEA_32.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_32.text: So you want me to kill the people hunting you?

Karlach_PostEA_210.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_210.text: Don't worry, I'll lead the charge. But I could use your help. There's a lot of them and only one of me. After that, we can team up. Take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

Karlach_PostEA_23.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_23.text: I have good news for you. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.

Karlach_PostEA_169.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_169.text: That's incredible! In that case, you ought to let me return the favour. My muscle for your aid in my battle against the powers of the arch-bitch.

Karlach_PostEA_204.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_204.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

Karlach_PostEA_339.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_339.text: But hey, erm, if we're going to travel together, I think there's something you should know.

Karlach_PostEA_332.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_332.text: Hear that? Infernal engine for a heart. Lets me burn as hot as the Hells. Seems to be running in overdrive since I left Avernus.
Karlach_PostEA_332.context:
CinematicNodeContext: "Hear that?"
She thumps her left chest with right hand, like pounding a car hood. Something mechanic clangs within.
(etc.)

Karlach_PostEA_108.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_108.text: Won't be seeing my mechanic any time soon, so I've been making the most of the extra heat. But it's meant I can't get too friendly. If I'm excited, nervous, scared, I'll light you up like a firework.

Karlach_PostEA_59.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_59.text: How the hells did you get an infernal engine for a heart?

Karlach_PostEA_166.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_166.text: High pain tolerance. And a dynamic duo of truly shitty bosses.

Karlach_PostEA_104.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_104.text: You have a mechanic for your heart?

Karlach_PostEA_300.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_300.text: Wild, right? And believe it or not, I'm one of Zariel's least-mutilated pets.

Karlach_PostEA_154.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_154.text: What does the engine allow you to do?

Karlach_PostEA_156.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_156.text: Burn, baby. As hot as I can tolerate. I have to admit it helps in battle, though I wouldn't have chosen it for myself - if I'd been given a choice.
Karlach_PostEA_156.context: NodeContext: First time discussing the origin of her heart

Karlach_PostEA_265.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_265.text: I'll tell you the story, but I really need to find someone who can tune up my engine sooner rather than later. Believe me when I say this thing is hot.

Karlach_PostEA_218.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_218.text: The first time I faced down those 'paladins,' they let slip they'd met an infernal mechanic in the area. A tiefling. But I didn't see him anywhere.

Karlach_PostEA_118.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_118.text: Wonder if they meant Dammon - a tiefling weaponsmith.

Karlach_PostEA_76.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_76.text: A weaponsmith, huh? Not sure if he's the guy, but I'd love to find out. A tune-up would do this rusty heart a world of good.

Karlach_PostEA_7.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_7.text: Why don't you clear things with your leader before we team up. Send 'em my way so we can work out the particulars.

Karlach_PostEA_15.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_15.text: If there's one thing Zariel taught me, it's not to fuck with the top dog until it's absolutely necessary.

Karlach_PostEA_387.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_387.text: No room in your party. What should I do?

Karlach_PostEA_115.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_115.text: All right - I'll catch up with you later. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

Karlach_PostEA_161.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_161.text: I'll catch up with you when it's time to camp, for now. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

Karlach_PostEA_256.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_256.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.

Karlach_PostEA_376.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_PostEA_376.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

Karlach_PostEA_176.speaker: Astarion
Karlach_PostEA_176.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
Karlach_PostEA_176.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

Karlach_PostEA_79.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_79.text: Gale could do with a rest.

Karlach_PostEA_21.speaker: Gale
Karlach_PostEA_21.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

Karlach_PostEA_171.speaker: Jaheira
Karlach_PostEA_171.text: Well. I know when I'm not wanted.
Karlach_PostEA_171.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

Karlach_PostEA_155.speaker: Shadowheart
Karlach_PostEA_155.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

Karlach_PostEA_221.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_221.text: You can trade places with Wyll.

Karlach_PostEA_135.speaker: Wyll
Karlach_PostEA_135.text: All right. I know a shortcut.

Karlach_PostEA_368.speaker: Halsin
Karlach_PostEA_368.text: I shall be waiting. Come find me when you need me.

Karlach_PostEA_348.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Karlach_PostEA_348.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

Karlach_PostEA_390.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_390.text: Hang on, though - looks like you've got enough backup at your side. Not sure there's room for me.

Karlach_PostEA_326.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_326.text: Phew, I'm getting all het up. Let's make tracks!

Karlach_PostEA_370.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_370.text: There are some tieflings holed up in a druid's grove nearby. We might look there.

Karlach_PostEA_25.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_25.text: Sounds like a good lead. Hopefully, our guy will be among them. A tune-up would do this old tub a world of good.

Karlach_PostEA_124.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_124.text: I'll keep an eye out for someone like that.

Karlach_PostEA_99.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_99.text: Thanking you. A tune-up would give this rustbox of mine a new lease on life.

Karlach_PostEA_44.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_44.text: What'll happen if you don't get tuned up?

Karlach_PostEA_160.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_160.text: Who knows! Maybe I can run like this indefinitely. But... maybe not.

Karlach_PostEA_234.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_234.text: I met someone who might be able to help - a smith who worked in the Hells for a time.

Karlach_PostEA_275.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_275.text: Well now! Maybe I could make his acquaintance? A tightened screw or two might let me keep a little calmer.

Karlach_PostEA_392.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_392.text: Maybe even manage a pat or bump without burning someone to death. It's been a long time.

Karlach_PostEA_9.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_9.text: If you can lead the way, I'll gladly follow.

Karlach_PostEA_320.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_320.text: I don't think so - you'll have to go it alone.

Karlach_PostEA_342.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_342.text: Damn. After a decade in hell, I was hoping for a little company. Especially some who looked like you.

Karlach_PostEA_281.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_281.text: But I can take a hint. Good luck out there. You're gonna need it.

Karlach_PostEA_383.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_383.text: I have good news for you. I took care of the paladins you say were hunting you.

Karlach_PostEA_249.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_249.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.

Karlach_PostEA_80.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_80.text: Why should I do your dirty work?

Karlach_PostEA_11.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_11.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. Gets even messier the more bodies you throw at it. Think of the potential.
Karlach_PostEA_11.context: NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

Karlach_PostEA_143.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_143.text: Why should I do your dirty work?

Karlach_PostEA_20.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_20.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. But there are a lot of them and just the one of me. I'll take point, and you flank 'em.

Karlach_PostEA_250.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_250.text: I'm here to kill you, not send you back to Zariel.

Karlach_PostEA_24.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_24.text: Too bad. I thought maybe you could be a friend. I could've done with one of those.

Karlach_PostEA_229.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_229.text: I have good news for you, then. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.

Karlach_PostEA_312.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_312.text: You did?! That's incredible! You ought to let me return the favour. We can team up - evict this parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

Karlach_PostEA_185.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_185.text: All right - welcome to the team.

Karlach_PostEA_189.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_189.text: Why don't you clear things with your leader before we team up. Send 'em my way so we can work out the particulars.

Karlach_PostEA_269.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_269.text: If there's one thing Zariel taught me, it's not to fuck with the top dog until it's absolutely necessary.

Karlach_PostEA_291.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_291.text: Hang on, though - looks like you've got enough backup at your side. Not sure there's room for me.

Karlach_PostEA_197.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_197.text: Head to my camp, then. We can regroup later.

Karlach_PostEA_93.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_93.text: All right, sure. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me. Got it?

Karlach_PostEA_261.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_261.text: Phew, I'm getting all het up. Let's make tracks!

Karlach_PostEA_279.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_279.text: I have good news for you, then. I already took care of the paladins you say were hunting you.

Karlach_PostEA_48.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_48.text: I have my own problems. I don't need yours.

Karlach_PostEA_167.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_167.text: I can see that. But look, if we take care of my little problem, we can move on to ours. The tadpole.

Karlach_PostEA_350.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_350.text: Kill some fiends, evict a parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

Karlach_PostEA_163.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_163.text: Karlach. I met someone named Wyll who was hunting you. He said you were a devil.

Karlach_PostEA_226.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_226.text: Ugh. Thought I'd lost the Blade of Frontiers on the mind flayer ship.

Karlach_PostEA_158.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_158.text: Well, if it isn't obvious by now, he's wrong about me. I'll prove it to him if he stops swinging that sword around long enough to listen to sense.

Karlach_PostEA_301.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_301.text: I'm your key to curing that tadpole - eventually.

Karlach_PostEA_60.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_60.text: Really now? First I catch a ride out of Avernus, then I stumble into a friend. Who's the goddess of luck again? I owe her a flower.

Karlach_PostEA_313.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_313.text: Now that we're old pals, how would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?

Karlach_PostEA_253.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_253.text: I'm not interested in making friends.

Karlach_PostEA_377.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_377.text: Oh boy, an arsehole! Winning you over will be entertaining.

Karlach_PostEA_33.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_33.text: Maybe it'll help if we start with a little fun. How'd you like to help me kill some evil bastards?

Karlach_PostEA_321.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_321.text: You know, I don't really want to kill you. So hear me out before you do something you can't take back.

Karlach_PostEA_38.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_38.text: You're a devil then. A soldier in the Blood War.

Karlach_PostEA_153.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_153.text: Not by choice. I'm a good skull-crusher, but I never wanted to serve Zariel.

Karlach_PostEA_56.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_56.text: You are a devil then. A soldier in the Blood War.

Karlach_PostEA_213.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_213.text: The paladins of Tyr were right. You are a devil.

Karlach_PostEA_224.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_224.text: What were you saying before we were interrupted?

Karlach_PostEA_374.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_374.text: Right. Some so-called paladins of Tyr are in hot pursuit of yours truly. Karlach.
Karlach_PostEA_374.context: NodeContext: She indicates herself by way of introduction, almost like she'd forgotten to mention her name earlier, then gestures to you as an invitation to introduce yourself.

Karlach_PostEA_8.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_8.text: I'm here to take your head.

Karlach_PostEA_63.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_63.text: Seems like you have a lot of enemies.

Karlach_PostEA_202.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_202.text: Nothing but. But... maybe you don't need to be one of 'em. You're no bounty hunter. I saw you before. On the mind flayers' ship.
Karlach_PostEA_202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire dies down. Calms to default state.

Karlach_PostEA_263.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_263.text: What quarrel do you have with these paladins?

Karlach_PostEA_389.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_389.text: Believe me, these guys are anything but holy knights. They serve an archdevil; the same one I -

Karlach_PostEA_201.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_201.text: I serve the Just God. What quarrel have you with His faithful?

Karlach_PostEA_132.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_132.text: None at all. In fact, it may upset you to hear some of Zariel's goons are posing as followers of your fella.

Karlach_PostEA_29.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_29.text: I'm in the process of teaching them a lesson about -

Karlach_PostEA_260.speaker: Player
Karlach_PostEA_260.text: I'm here to kill you, not make small talk.

Karlach_PostEA_181.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_PostEA_181.text: *One horn. This is the devil Wyll has been tasked to kill.*

Karlach_PostEA_112.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_PostEA_112.text: *One horn. This is the devil you've been tasked to kill.*

Karlach_PostEA_252.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_252.text: Hope you're not planning on taking another swing at me, mate. Might not go your way this time.
Karlach_PostEA_252.context: NodeContext: Last time you saw the player they attacked you.

Karlach_PostEA_305.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_PostEA_305.text: There you are. Thought I'd have to track you down myself, murderer.

PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate_0.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate_0.text: There's a pressure plate in the chair, but I'm missing something.

Karlach_63.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_63.text: Piss off, you little vulture. I'm not dead yet.

Karlach_57.speaker: Player
Karlach_57.text: The people hunting you are. I took care of it.

Karlach_93.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_93.text: Why the change of heart? Ah, doesn't matter - thank you.
Karlach_93.context: NodeContext: suspicious on first phrase, then pleased

Karlach_126.speaker: Player
Karlach_126.text: You will be soon - I'm taking your head.

Karlach_138.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_138.text: Could have sworn I told you to piss off. Maybe I imagined it.

Karlach_115.speaker: Player
Karlach_115.text: I met the people looking for you - and killed them.

Karlach_51.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_51.text: Oh. Sorry I told you to piss off just now. Come on over here - we should talk.
Karlach_51.context: NodeContext: surprise on 'oh' - and then smilling as she apologises

Karlach_143.speaker: Player
Karlach_143.text: They said you're a fiend, that you belong in hell.

Karlach_268.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_268.text: If you killed them, I'm guessing you didn't buy their bullshit.

Karlach_231.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_231.text: I don't belong in hell any more than you do. But I was there.
Karlach_231.context: NodeContext: matter of fact on first sentence, then preparing to tell us a cool story on the next

Karlach_79.speaker: Player
Karlach_79.text: You shouldn't be sorry - I'm going to kill you as well.

Karlach_155.speaker: Player
Karlach_155.text: I met the people looking for you. They say you're a killer - a fiend.

Karlach_276.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_276.text: And you believe them? Those bastards are trying to feed you a crock of shit.

Karlach_193.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_193.text: Hold up. One more step, and I put a bolt through your eye.
Karlach_193.context: NodeContext: slumped against wall, crossbow on her lap - she raises it wearily and points it at us, then speaks with authority

Karlach_178.context: CinematicNodeContext: stands, holding the crossbow in one hand, her other hand pressed to a wound on the left of her stomach. She appraises the player.

Karlach_27.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_27.text: No sudden movements, or you're dead.

Karlach_41.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_41.context: NodeContext: Almost like 'bring it on' - she's expecting a fight

Karlach_266.speaker: Player
Karlach_266.text: No, but I see you're hurt - let me help.

Karlach_161.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_161.text: Hurt or not, I won't miss - lung, heart, arse or eye. Take your pick.
Karlach_161.context: NodeContext: small gestures with the crossbow, aiming at the bodyparts as she calls them out

Karlach_253.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_253.text: Tell me what you're doing here. Now.
Karlach_253.context: NodeContext: About to loser her temper, but still keeping it for now

Karlach_197.speaker: Player
Karlach_197.text: I'm hunting a fiend - you fit the description.

Karlach_245.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_245.text: Somebody fed you a crock of shit, and you swallowed the lot.
Karlach_245.context: NodeContext: not judging us - realising she might be able to trust us, we've just been deceived about her

Karlach_225.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Karlach lowers the crossbow, grimacing in pain

Karlach_97.speaker: Player
Karlach_97.text: I was warned you're dangerous - so am I.

Karlach_201.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_201.text: If you bite as hard as you bark, we might just get along. I'm dangerous all right, but I've got no quarrel with you.
Karlach_201.context: NodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

Karlach_89.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_89.text: I reckon you've been sold a crock of shit about me.
Karlach_89.context: NodeContext: starting to realise she might be able to trust us

Karlach_75.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_75.text: Don't sweat it - devils are tricky fuckers. They can't breathe without lying.
Karlach_75.context: NodeContext: casually forgiving us for believing lies about her - she's very casual about devils

Karlach_77.speaker: Player
Karlach_77.text: They're not breathing anymore - I killed them.

Karlach_60.speaker: Player
Karlach_60.text: Hold on - the people I spoke to were paladins, not devils.

Karlach_103.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_103.text: Sure they were - and I'm Tiamat's left tit.
Karlach_103.context: NodeContext: sarcastic - Tiamat - TYAH-maht / tyɑ mɑt

Karlach_242.speaker: Player
Karlach_242.text: If you're not a fiend, what are you?

Karlach_66.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_66.text: Are you demented? I'm a tiefling - same as you. More or less.
Karlach_66.context: NodeContext: astonished by how dense we are (on the 'are you demented' variation, she's gesturing toward her horns (she's missing one) when she says more or less)

Karlach_122.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_122.text: I guess they told you I bite the heads off babies, and paint myself in their blood.
Karlach_122.context: NodeContext: as if telling an exaggerated story about a boogeyman

Karlach_20.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_20.text: Truth's not quite so exciting. Come on over and I'll tell you the whole story.
Karlach_20.context: NodeContext: friendly, gesturing for us to come closer - we're still across the river at this point.

Karlach_81.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_81.text: I'm a fugitive - escaped from the Hells, and those bastards are trying to take me back.
Karlach_81.context: NodeContext: an incredible story delivered as if it's everyday life

Karlach_184.speaker: Player
Karlach_184.text: You were in hell? So was I, not long ago.

Karlach_80.speaker: Player
Karlach_80.text: I visited Avernus recently - seemed delightful.

Karlach_191.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_191.text: *As she winces, agony shoots through you, as if your bodies share the same wound.*
Karlach_191.context: NodeContext: She clutches her side, wincing

Karlach_87.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_87.text: *Then you're lost in visions of demonic armies, as you tear through a landscape of fire and blood.*

Karlach_256.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_256.text: *The Blood War. You saw it from above as the nautiloid passed through Avernus - this woman was on the frontline.*

Karlach_47.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_47.text: Ster'ca. What was that? You were inside my head...
Karlach_47.context: CinematicNodeContext: she's startled, angry - her eyes flash with fireNodeContext: ster'ca (stir-KA (very harsh KA)) is a curse word in infernal language. She's shocked, a little afraid of us

Karlach_233.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_233.text: That was one of my good days - the bad ones would knock you sick.

Karlach_198.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_198.text: Now tell me what you just did to me before I make sure you can never do it again.

Karlach_111.speaker: Player
Karlach_111.text: It wasn't me - it's the parasites from the mind flayer ship. They connected us.

Karlach_207.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_207.text: Hold on a minute - you were on that ship? With the tentacles, and the worms?
Karlach_207.context: NodeContext: we just surprised her - first phrase is like 'woah, slow down' energy.

Karlach_72.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_72.text: I didn't think anyone else had survived.
Karlach_72.context: NodeContext: amazed and a slight touch of guilt - if she'd known there were survivors she might have stuck around to help

Karlach_230.speaker: Player
Karlach_230.text: I didn't see you aboard. Where were you?

Karlach_48.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_48.text: I boarded in Avernus - that ship was my way out.
Karlach_48.context: NodeContext: simple explanation of fantastical event - Avernus = hell

Karlach_240.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_240.text: No - I just saw a chance and I took it.

Karlach_171.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_171.text: That ship could have been heading for Sigil or Limbo for all I cared - anything was better than staying.
Karlach_171.context: NodeContext: with a shrug, summarising her improvised escape plan Sigil - /ˈsɪdʒ ɪl/

Karlach_188.speaker: Player
Karlach_188.text: Stowing away aboard a mind flayer's nautiloid? Pretty stupid.

Karlach_54.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_54.text: If you'd seen as much of hell as I have, you'd rather have a flayer's tentacles up your arse than stay.
Karlach_54.context: NodeContext: making a serious point, but drily amused

Karlach_82.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_82.text: And I'll be going straight back if those imp-fuckers catch me.
Karlach_82.context: NodeContext: 'straight back' to hell. said with concern. the 'imp-fuckers' are cultists

Karlach_65.speaker: Player
Karlach_65.text: What makes you so important to them?

Karlach_172.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_172.text: I was a prisoner, forced to fight in the Blood War - the eternal battle between bad and worse.
Karlach_172.context: NodeContext: casually summarising cosmic events as if they're everyday

Karlach_135.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_135.text: Most souls in Avernus are just meat for the grinder. But not me.

Karlach_149.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_149.text: I held my own. More than. Turns out I've got a knack for killing demons - and I enjoy it. That made me a valuable asset.
Karlach_149.context: NodeContext: she's enjoying telling us this - bigging herself up and relishing it

Karlach_30.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_30.text: Devils don't like to lose their assets.
Karlach_30.context: NodeContext: doomed resignation - here's her central problem - she's the 'asset' in this case

Karlach_238.speaker: Player
Karlach_238.text: Hard to believe you're a demon-slayer when you can't deal with a few cultists.

Karlach_173.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_173.text: Back in the Blood War, my commander gave me what I needed to get the job done. I had fire running through my veins.
Karlach_173.context: NodeContext: Explaining in a matter of fact way. last sentence is with a smile - remembering it fondly. The fire running through her veins is a reference to having hellish magical abilities

Karlach_22.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_22.text: I don't work for her anymore so I'm back to relying on muscle and steel - I'll be just fine.
Karlach_22.context: NodeContext: "I'll be just fine" with a smile. She's tough and she knows it.

Karlach_120.speaker: Player
Karlach_120.text: So you want me to kill the people hunting you?

Karlach_250.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_250.context: NodeContext: punching her fist into her palm and grinning

Karlach_121.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_121.text: They cornered me in the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the beating I gave them.
Karlach_121.context: NodeContext: explaining the situation, pleased we're helping

Karlach_9.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_9.text: I'd come with you just to see them bleed, but I'm too busy bleeding myself. I'll be here when you're done.
Karlach_9.context: NodeContext: gestures at the wound in her side (same one she was clutching earlier) on 'too busy bleeding myself'. She's fairly casual about how much she's bleeding

Karlach_136.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_136.text: Figures. I'll see you in hell one day, arsehole.

Karlach_162.speaker: Player
Karlach_162.text: What do I get in return?

Karlach_68.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_68.text: You get a friend who spat in Baphomet's eye and lived to tell the tale.
Karlach_68.context: NodeContext: cocky, with a big grin - Baphomet (Baff-oh-met)

Karlach_8.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_8.text: They're not the kind of people you can run from. I need them dead.
Karlach_8.context: NodeContext: dismissing a suggestion to run

Karlach_101.speaker: Player
Karlach_101.text: I'm not doing it - you're on your own.

Karlach_226.speaker: Player
Karlach_226.text: And they need you dead - I'm ending you.

Karlach_119.speaker: Player
Karlach_119.text: I'm done listening - I'm ending you.

Karlach_73.speaker: Player
Karlach_73.text: Judging by the wound, I'm guessing they already found you.

Karlach_166.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_166.text: Yeah. Not far from here - gang of cultists cornered me in an abandoned tollhouse.

Karlach_177.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_177.text: I took out a couple, but I need them all dead.

Karlach_17.speaker: Player
Karlach_17.text: If I do this, what do I get in return?

Karlach_13.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_13.text: A gang of cultists cornered me in an abandoned tollhouse, not far from here.

Karlach_213.speaker: Player
Karlach_213.text: I don't believe a word of this.

Karlach_98.speaker: Player
Karlach_98.text: Why were you in hell in the first place?

Karlach_6.speaker: Player
Karlach_6.text: They don't need to catch you - I already did. You're finished.

Karlach_3.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_3.text: Ha. Even if you take me, I'll see you in hell one day. And I'll rip your godsdamned spine out.
Karlach_3.context: NodeContext: short, performative and dismissive 'ha'. Then threatening and relishing the chance to fight us

Karlach_34.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_34.text: You gave me some breathing room when you killed those imp-fuckers, but more will come.

Karlach_216.speaker: Player
Karlach_216.text: Why are you so important to them?

Karlach_117.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_117.text: Most souls in the Blood War are just meat for the grinder, but not me.
Karlach_117.context: NodeContext: proud, grinning, enjoying bigging herself up

Karlach_58.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_58.text: Safety in numbers? Not a bad idea.

Karlach_5.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_5.text: Sorry - I left all my soul coins in hell.
Karlach_5.context: NodeContext: sarcastic - soul coins are the currency of hell

Karlach_10.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_10.text: But I won't forget what you did, and I hope I can pay you back down the line.

Karlach_206.speaker: Player
Karlach_206.text: You must have got clear of the crash site in a hurry.

Karlach_92.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_92.text: The place would have been crawling with cultists if I'd stuck around - and they'd have dragged us all back to Avernus.
Karlach_92.context: NodeContext: calmly explaining a bad situation - Avernus = hell

Karlach_31.speaker: Player
Karlach_31.text: I didn't do it on purpose.

Karlach_217.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_217.text: That's what I thought - it was something inside you. I felt it. One of those godsdamned worms, from the ship.

Karlach_70.speaker: Player
Karlach_70.text: That was the least of what I can do.

Karlach_33.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_33.text: I'll knock your teeth down your throat if you keep playing games - this is serious. What was that?
Karlach_33.context: NodeContext: threatening, but still curious, especially on last phrase

Karlach_235.speaker: Player
Karlach_235.text: Hold up - you fought in the Blood War?

Karlach_246.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_246.context: NodeContext: proud, but making out it's no big deal

Karlach_127.speaker: Player
Karlach_127.text: Yes, and I saw hell. You really are a fiend.

Karlach_108.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_108.text: Fuck this - I'm done being reasonable.

Karlach_145.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_145.text: It's not - it's a shitting catastrophe. But at least I'm out.
Karlach_145.context: NodeContext: agreeding with our assessment of her situation

Karlach_219.speaker: Player
Karlach_219.text: I know - and I can save their souls by killing you.

Karlach_32.speaker: Player
Karlach_32.text: I know - they offered a fine reward for your head. I intend to claim it.

Karlach_40.speaker: Player
Karlach_40.text: You said yourself, devils are tricksters. I don't believe a word of this.

Karlach_174.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_174.text: You're picking the wrong side here - those bastards aren't what they claim to be.
Karlach_174.context: NodeContext: irritated, but trying to convince us to take her side

Karlach_183.speaker: Player
Karlach_183.text: All right, I'm listening - what's really going on here?

Karlach_203.speaker: Player
Karlach_203.text: They told me you'd slaughtered innocent families.

Karlach_267.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_267.text: Bullshit. I've never killed anyone who didn't deserve it.
Karlach_267.context: NodeContext: harsh on bullshit - adamant on rest

Karlach_11.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_11.text: Awful lot of people do deserve it though, don't you find?
Karlach_11.context: NodeContext: thoughtful - she's talking about people who deserve to be killed

Karlach_123.speaker: Player
Karlach_123.text: Not another word - I'm ending you.

Karlach_39.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_39.context: NodeContext: we just threatened to kill her and she's relishing the fight - convinced she'll kick our asses

Karlach_274.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_274.text: But if you do cut me down - I'll see you in the Hells one day and return the favour. Count on it.
Karlach_274.context: NodeContext: we just threatened to kill her and she's relishing the fight - convinced she'll kick our asses

Karlach_116.speaker: Player
Karlach_116.text: If you keep pointing that thing at me this is going to end badly for you.

Karlach_181.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_181.text: Hm. If you bite as hard as you bark, we might get along. I might even have a job for you.
Karlach_181.context: NodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

Karlach_277.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_277.text: Cute. I've scraped more frightening things than you off my boot.

Karlach_114.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_114.text: Either piss off, or show me what you're made of.

Karlach_86.speaker: Player
Karlach_86.text: I just want to know what's going on here, I swear.

Karlach_110.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_110.text: All right. Maybe the blood-loss is making me soft, but I'm going to trust you. For now.
Karlach_110.context: CinematicNodeContext: lowers the crossbow, grimacing in painNodeContext: appraising us, starting to trust us

Karlach_59.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_59.text: I'm in a tight spot - might not be able to get out of it alone.
Karlach_59.context: NodeContext: annoyed she has to admit this - she's used to being self-dependent

Karlach_194.speaker: Player
Karlach_194.text: Maybe I can help - fill me in.

Karlach_19.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_19.text: Oh, I have. The kind of battles a cub like you sees in their nightmares.
Karlach_19.context: NodeContext: 'cub' as a minor insult about our combat experience - trying to intimidate us a little. Enjoying it

Karlach_221.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_221.text: I'm having a very bad day.
Karlach_221.context: NodeContext: we just said she was very intense, she's like 'well, yes'

Karlach_88.speaker: Player
Karlach_88.text: You've got my attention - what's your story?

Karlach_1.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_1.text: All right. Come on over here. But fair warning - you might find this hard to believe.
Karlach_1.context: NodeContext: allowing us to come closer - she's going to tell us her story and it's intense

Karlach_26.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_26.text: I'm a fugitive. I escaped the Hells, and the bastards who were holding me there are trying to take me back.
Karlach_26.context: NodeContext: an incredible story delivered as if it's everyday life

Karlach_168.speaker: Player
Karlach_168.text: If I help you, what's in it for me?

Karlach_154.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_154.text: You get a friend who'll put a dent in the skull of anyone who pisses you off.
Karlach_154.context: NodeContext: describing herself - matter of fact and quite friendly

Karlach_14.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_14.text: I'm good at reading people - there's a knack to it -  and I'm only getting one word from you.
Karlach_14.context: NodeContext: appraising us, unimpressed - the one word, in her next line, is 'horseshit'

Karlach_175.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_175.context: NodeContext: dismissive - summarising what we just said in one word - thinks we're liars

Karlach_263.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_263.text: Piss off, or show me what you're made of.

Karlach_84.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_84.text: And I'm none of yours. So piss off.
Karlach_84.context: NodeContext: responding 'none of your damn business' - very aggressive on final phrase

Karlach_90.speaker: Player
Karlach_90.text: Yes I am - the people who are hunting you sent me.

Karlach_61.speaker: Player
Karlach_61.text: I have no idea who you are.

Karlach_69.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_69.text: You just happened to stumble across me, here in the arse-end of nowhere? Bullshit.
Karlach_69.context: NodeContext: doesn't believe a word of it

Karlach_15.speaker: Player
Karlach_15.text: I met the others who were sent for you - told them I'd help.

Karlach_211.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_211.context: CinematicNodeContext: clutches her wounded side as she greets usNodeContext: grimace of pain as she greets us

Karlach_252.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_252.context: NodeContext: resignation that her troubles aren't over on 'for now', then gratitude

Karlach_50.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_50.text: *Her mind touches yours - gratitude, warmth, and relief.*

Karlach_165.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_165.text: *Then a light, sharper than the truest blade, brighter than a star. It fills you with awe, forcing you to your knees.*

Karlach_157.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_157.text: *And from within, a winged figure steps forward, graceful and terrible. She places her hand on your cheek.*

Karlach_125.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_125.text: *And smiles as she carves her name across your chest.*

Karlach_167.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_167.context: NodeContext: gasping, in shock, speaking to the person in her vision rather than to us. Defiant. Infernal language - means 'I don't belong to you'. (Qua-ad voss none pet-ree-kah)

Karlach_42.speaker: Narrator
Karlach_42.text: Her words are spoken in the infernal tongue of devils. A threat, or a plea: 'I don't belong to you'.

Karlach_141.speaker: Player
Karlach_141.text: She thinks she owns you? Who is she?

Karlach_37.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_37.text: Zariel. Fallen lady, defiled celestial... ruler of Avernus. I was her prisoner, and her champion.
Karlach_37.context: NodeContext: Building up to the reveal on 'ruler of Avernus'. She's describing an archdevil - it's a big deal. Zariel (ZAR-ee-el)

Karlach_192.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_192.text: The paladins you killed were acting on her orders - she'll send more. And worse.

Karlach_129.speaker: Player
Karlach_129.text: What will you do if she sends more?

Karlach_46.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_46.text: Oh, I'm counting on it. I'll be ready for her.

Karlach_78.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_78.text: And the first step is to go home - to Baldur's Gate. I've got a score to settle.
Karlach_78.context: NodeContext: continuing with the determination - she's going to kick someone's ass

Karlach_273.speaker: Player
Karlach_273.text: Not many people survive an archdevil's fury.

Karlach_64.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_64.text: I haven't survived her yet. She'll come for me - and I'll need to be ready.
Karlach_64.context: NodeContext: making it clear her battle isn't over, grimly determined

Karlach_257.speaker: Player
Karlach_257.text: Who was that? In your memory?

Karlach_140.speaker: Player
Karlach_140.text: I've never heard that language before.

Karlach_104.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_104.text: Lucky you. It's the devils' tongue - infernal. Good for cursing and counting, not so good for small talk.
Karlach_104.context: NodeContext: faint smile on 'lucky you'. Then trying to make a joke about something awful

Karlach_215.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_215.text: I'm going from one hell straight into another - home, to Baldur's Gate. I've got a score to settle.

Karlach_12.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_12.text: I could use the company, but until I've shaken Zariel off my back, I'd only put a target on yours.
Karlach_12.context: NodeContext: regretting turning down our offer to join our party - but convinced it's for our own good

Karlach_232.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_232.text: My advice? Stay away from the city. When I catch up with the fuckers who did this to me, the streets will run red.
Karlach_232.context: NodeContext: relishing this - she's heading out on a bloody revenge spree and she's really looking forward to it

Karlach_248.speaker: Player
Karlach_248.text: My offer still stands - let's travel together.

Karlach_229.speaker: Player
Karlach_229.text: Who are you looking for in the city?

Karlach_156.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_156.text: Politicians. The fuckers who sent me to hell in the first place.
Karlach_156.context: NodeContext: describing her enemies - she really doesn't like them

Karlach_186.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_186.text: My advice? Stay away from the city. When I catch up with them, the streets will run red.
Karlach_186.context: NodeContext: relishing this - she's heading out on a bloody revenge spree and she's really looking forward to it

Karlach_200.speaker: Player
Karlach_200.text: Aren't you worried about what the parasite's doing to you?

Karlach_7.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_7.text: And what is it doing to me exactly? I barely felt a wriggle from it 'til you came along.
Karlach_7.context: NodeContext: talking about the parasite - she's not concerned about it, more curious

Karlach_190.speaker: Player
Karlach_190.text: It'll turn you into a mind flayer.

Karlach_222.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_222.text: Doesn't seem to have turned you into a mind flayer, unless you've tucked your tentacles down your throat.

Karlach_224.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_224.text: I'll start worrying when it gives me a reason to.

Karlach_23.speaker: Karlach
Karlach_23.text: Take your time - it's only my soul on the line.

Karlach_271.speaker: Player
Karlach_271.text: I decided to help them instead. I'm taking your head.

AD_KarlachWounded_0.speaker: Karlach
AD_KarlachWounded_0.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself as she tends to a wound

AD_KarlachWounded_1.speaker: Karlach
AD_KarlachWounded_1.context: NodeContext: (Stir-KA - very harsh KA) a curse, in the infernal tongue. Quietly, as she tends a sore wound

AD_KarlachWounded_2.speaker: Karlach
AD_KarlachWounded_2.context: NodeContext: muttered to herself as she tends a wound

Dead_Karlach_18.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Karlach_18.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Dead_Karlach_11.speaker: Player
Dead_Karlach_11.text: Why are you known as the Demonsbane?

Dead_Karlach_0.speaker: Player
Dead_Karlach_0.text: I was told you're a fiend and a killer. Is that true?

Dead_Karlach_16.speaker: Karlach
Dead_Karlach_16.text: Lies... she hunts me... won't let me go...

Dead_Karlach_22.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Karlach_22.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Dead_Karlach_24.speaker: Narrator
Dead_Karlach_24.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

PAD_Karlach_0.speaker: Karlach
PAD_Karlach_0.context: NodeContext: To self, while burning, pre-recruitment

PAD_Karlach_1.speaker: Karlach
PAD_Karlach_1.context: NodeContext: To self, while burning, pre-recruitment

PAD_Karlach_2.speaker: Karlach
PAD_Karlach_2.context: NodeContext: To self, while burning, pre-recruitment

PAD_Karlach_3.speaker: Karlach
PAD_Karlach_3.context: NodeContext: To self, while burning, pre-recruitment

AD_KarlachHealed_0.speaker: Karlach
AD_KarlachHealed_0.text: Thanks. That was really starting to hurt.

AD_KarlachHealed_1.speaker: Karlach
AD_KarlachHealed_1.text: If you cast anything at me, I'll break your fingers.
AD_KarlachHealed_1.context: NodeContext: calmly and casually warning a player from casting a spell on her - even if it's a healing spell.

HeadLoot_0.speaker: Narrator
HeadLoot_0.text: *A faint, acrid smell clings to the corpse - like the memory of a storm.*
HeadLoot_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of Karlach's dead body.

HeadLoot_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: player removes head off-camera - but maybe show either a reaction shot as they prepare to decapitate

HeadLoot_4.speaker: Narrator
HeadLoot_4.text: *The head comes free with a sickening crunch.*
